intro: Agathaea barbata, commonly known as the hairy agathaea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to greenish in color, with a showy appearance. Agathaea barbata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
